Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TSacchetto

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TSacchetto
  • public class TSacchetto
extends Object
    A TSacchetto object behaves exactly as the ballot box ('sacchetto', in Italian language) that contains the 90 figures of the Tombola game and is used to extract them one at a time before mark each number on the Tombola billboard ('Tabellone'). Numbers can be extracted just one at a time and will come out in a random, unpredictable order. This object has also methods that support alignment with number extraction made manually form a real, physical ballot box, methods for rollback in case of mistakes, etc. Happy tombola game to everyone!
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
    See Also:
    TGame, TCard

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TSacchetto()
      Default constructor: the TSacchetto object is filled with 90 numbers well shaken and mixed up using a randomly initialized java.util.Random number generators object, so use this constructor if you have no need to 'reproduce' the exact sequence of extracted numbers.
      TSacchetto​(long seed)
      TSacchetto constructor that allows the TombolaLib user to specify the random seed initialization value, so that it will be possible to build another identical TSacchetto object, that is a ballot box that will perform the same extraction sequence.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int extract()
      Extract the next random number from the sacchetto, returning -1 is all numbers have already been extracted and the sacchetto is empty.
      int[] getExtractedAsArray()
      Return an array containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, in the same order by which they come out from the ballot box, return null if no number has been already extracted.
      List<Integer> getExtractedAsList()
      Return a List containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, in the same order by which they come out from the ballot box, return null if no number has been already extracted.
      int getExtractedCount()
      Return the amount of already extracted numbers of tombola.
      List<Integer> getExtractionHistory()
      Return the List of all numbers already extracted except the last one (see getLastExtracted()), ordering them from the most recent extracted to the oldest one. An empty, not null list is returned if less than two numbers have been extracted.
      List<Integer> getExtractionHistory​(int limit)
      Return the List of numbers already extracted except the last one (see getLastExtracted()), ordering them from the most recent extracted to the oldest one. An empty, not null list is returned if less than two numbers have been extracted.
      int getExtractionMoment​(int number)
      Return the extraction count at which the number has been extracted, -1 if it has not been extracted jet.
      int getLastExtracted()
      Return the last number extracted from the sacchetto, without any change to the status of the sacchetto itself; return -1 is no number has been already extracted.
      long getRandomSeed()
      Return the seed long value used to initialize the Random number generator used to mix and shake the numbers within the sacchetto object.
      int[] getToExtractAsArray()
      Return an array containing, in ascending order, all the numbers that have still not been extracted from the sacchetto, null if all 90 numbers have been already extracted.
      boolean isExtracted​(int number)
      Return true is the number passed as input argument has been already extracted.
      int manuallyExtract​(int manualExtracted)
      Align the sacchetto object forcing the extraction of the number passed as input parameter that, of course, must be a number within the [1..90] range that has not been previously extracted.
      int rollBack()
      Undo the last extraction operation putting the last extracted numbers again into the sacchetto object (of course, as happens using a physical sacchetto, the next extract() operation will eventually return a different number!).
      void shake()
      Shake the remaining numbers in the sacchetto, thus increasing the randomness by which they are extracted so, call it from time to time!
      static void simpleTest()
      Undocumented test support code (TODO: DELETE and add JUnit Tests!)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • TSacchetto

        public TSacchetto()
        Default constructor: the TSacchetto object is filled with 90 numbers well shaken and mixed up using a randomly initialized java.util.Random number generators object, so use this constructor if you have no need to 'reproduce' the exact sequence of extracted numbers.

      • TSacchetto

        public TSacchetto​(long seed)
        TSacchetto constructor that allows the TombolaLib user to specify the random seed initialization value, so that it will be possible to build another identical TSacchetto object, that is a ballot box that will perform the same extraction sequence.
        Parameters:
        seed - the random number generator initialization seed

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomSeed

        public long getRandomSeed()
        Return the seed long value used to initialize the Random number generator used to mix and shake the numbers within the sacchetto object.
        Returns:
        long value used to initialize the Random number generator

      • extract

        public int extract()
        Extract the next random number from the sacchetto, returning -1 is all numbers have already been extracted and the sacchetto is empty.
        Returns:
        the next random number extracted from the sacchetto, -1 if the ballot bow is empty

      • getExtractionMoment

        public int getExtractionMoment​(int number)
        Return the extraction count at which the number has been extracted, -1 if it has not been extracted jet.
        Parameters:
        number - the number you want to know when has been extracted
        Returns:
        the 'moment' (i.e. extraction count) at which the number has been extracted, -1 if it is still in the ballot box.

      • isExtracted

        public boolean isExtracted​(int number)
        Return true is the number passed as input argument has been already extracted.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to check
        Returns:
        true is the number passed as input argument has been already extracted.

      • manuallyExtract

        public int manuallyExtract​(int manualExtracted)
        Align the sacchetto object forcing the extraction of the number passed as input parameter that, of course, must be a number within the [1..90] range that has not been previously extracted. Return the extracted number (i.e. the same value passed in input) if it is found in the sacchetto, -1 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        manualExtracted - the number you want to extract (i.e. you have extracted manually and want maintain aligned the TSacchetto object.
        Returns:
        the extracted number (the same value passed in input) if it is found in the sacchetto, -1 otherwise.

      • shake

        public void shake()
        Shake the remaining numbers in the sacchetto, thus increasing the randomness by which they are extracted so, call it from time to time!

      • getExtractedCount

        public int getExtractedCount()
        Return the amount of already extracted numbers of tombola.
        Returns:
        the amount of already extracted numbers of tombola.

      • getLastExtracted

        public int getLastExtracted()
        Return the last number extracted from the sacchetto, without any change to the status of the sacchetto itself; return -1 is no number has been already extracted.
        Returns:
        the last number extracted from the sacchetto, -1 if the sacchetto is new (no number has been already extracted)

      • getExtractedAsArray

        public int[] getExtractedAsArray()
        Return an array containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, in the same order by which they come out from the ballot box, return null if no number has been already extracted.
        Returns:
        an array containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, null if no number has been already extracted

      • getExtractedAsList

        public List<Integer> getExtractedAsList()
        Return a List containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, in the same order by which they come out from the ballot box, return null if no number has been already extracted.
        Returns:
        a List object containing the numbers already extracted from the sacchetto, null if no number has been already extracted

      • getExtractionHistory

        public List<Integer> getExtractionHistory()
        Return the List of all numbers already extracted except the last one (see getLastExtracted()), ordering them from the most recent extracted to the oldest one. An empty, not null list is returned if less than two numbers have been extracted.
        Returns:
        the all numbers already extracted, excluded the last one.

      • getExtractionHistory

        public List<Integer> getExtractionHistory​(int limit)
        Return the List of numbers already extracted except the last one (see getLastExtracted()), ordering them from the most recent extracted to the oldest one. An empty, not null list is returned if less than two numbers have been extracted.
        Parameters:
        limit - specified how many numbers should be included in the returned list.
        Returns:
        the last 'limit' numbers already extracted, excluded the last one.

      • getToExtractAsArray

        public int[] getToExtractAsArray()
        Return an array containing, in ascending order, all the numbers that have still not been extracted from the sacchetto, null if all 90 numbers have been already extracted.
        Returns:
        an array containing, in ascending order, all the numbers that have still not been extracted from the sacchetto, null if all 90 numbers have been already extracted.

      • rollBack

        public int rollBack()
        Undo the last extraction operation putting the last extracted numbers again into the sacchetto object (of course, as happens using a physical sacchetto, the next extract() operation will eventually return a different number!).
        Returns:
        1 if the rollback operation succeeded, -1 in case of error (for example, if you try to invoke rollback even before the first number extraction)

        Undocumented test support code (TODO: DELETE and add JUnit Tests!)
